website_summaries.verdict: The Raindrip water timer is a basic device for basic watering issues, so users should understand their personal needs before purchasing. Very affordable retail price point, so several can be put to use in different zones or on different devices.
pros: Universal fitting will work on most outdoor faucets, irrigation tubing or sprinkler outlets
Up to 72 hours of rain delay possible
Easy programming uses analog system, not digital
cons: Some durability and longevity issues have been reported
Can only be used on one watering device at a time
User must physically activate the timer at some point, not completely automatic

customer_reviews.title: More garbage
customer_reviews.text: Every single one we've had failed in less than a year. People need to stop reviewing water timers if they haven't been using them for at least a year. We have yet to find a single brand than can routinely make it multiple years. I'm to the point where I'm going to build my own using relayed sprinkler valves. There's just nothing that I can find for really any price that is made to withstand daily use for more than a season or two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product failed in 35 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought it on July 5. On August 10 I realize it's not running. The plant nearly died. Last day to return it was a week ago. And you can't call them. Raindrip gives you a phone number for orders, but they say the people who answer can't help you. There is no contact information for technical support. So I guess I'm just screwed.
customer_reviews.author: BDMSB

customer_reviews.title: One year lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Raindrip R675ct last year, worked well. Took out batteries, and indoors for the winter. This year, put in fresh batteries, and would not come on. Another set of batteries, same thing. I thing the valve was frozen. The lights came on. ( I did use it with a pressure reducer, 25psi.) One reviewer stated people should wait a year to review, so here it is. I'm trying the Melnor HydroLogic 1-Zone Digital Water Timer this year, we will see. At least I got the Melnor when it dropped to $24. So far it is working well.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Howes

customer_reviews.title: Great auto on/off hose timer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about 2 months now. No glitches or problems so far. It has a no frills approach to set up which is nice. I have used other timers with LCD's and extra bells and whistles but fail miserably at actually watering correctly (ie.). Hope this holds up once summer arrives. Update: 03/07/16 So this little device has been trucking along for over a year. I believe i have had to replace the batteries once. It has worked wonderfully at automatically watering some new trees I planted back in 2011. These are great devices! Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: hiowatha

customer_reviews.title: Auto mode is the weakest link in the design.
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine in continuous operation for 16 months in Texas climate. After six months the automatic mode stopped working. Manual mode still works. I tested the batteries and though they were good I swapped in a new verified set that measures 1.6v each. The light for auto mode flashes but the valve never opens, not immediately, not in an hour, not in 12 hours, not in 72 hours. But flip the dial to manual and manual light blinks and the valve opens.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Rocket

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product, Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product at an affordable price. When using the "manual" mode, make sure that mode is turned off before you turn on the water source feeding this device. Then, set the manual mode to the time you want - for example, 30 minutes. Then, turn on the water source. You may also want to buy a water-pressure regulator, and set it at no more than 20 PSI (pounds per square inch). Because the holes in the tubing that runs from this device to your garden plot are so small, too much water pressure can cause the water to not flow out of those holes.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jones-D'Agostino

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a couple weeks.  All plants dead.
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working just a couple weeks after I installed it. I changed the batteries but that wasn't the problem. The motor is not properly activating the pressure plug that starts and stops the flow of water, so all the plants on my deck died while I was on vacation because the timer was properly going on and off but the mechanics failed. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: S. Kallshian

customer_reviews.title: I have to say this one has been so far the best. I think that fact that its analog helps ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased all kinds of these things. I have to say this one has been so far the best. I think that fact that its analog helps alot. Those LCD screens that some of these have tend to go bad and then you pretty much have a paper weight. With this one there is no LCD just dials which should last much longer. Not to mention battery life is way better as a result..
customer_reviews.author: RONALD

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use. One failed but they replaced it free.
customer_reviews.text: We like how simple this is to use. Even the kids understand it. You just have to know to do "reset" before changing the manual modes. Rain Delay works excellently. The unit is heavy-duty. Ours failed after a month. It looks like it got an internal leak. We dried it out and it worked but once we put water to it the power (indicated by the lights) went out. I called Raindrip/NDS and they replaced it promptly. I talked to a US-based technician who was extremely friendly. No wait time. Excellent Support!!!
customer_reviews.author: The Irelands

customer_reviews.title: Flooded my kitchen garden
customer_reviews.text: This water time was amazing for about two weeks and took a lot of stress out of my day. It did leak from both ends but I was willing to put up with it for the convenience. However, after that two week mark, the time function stopped working on both automatic and manual mode. It completely flooded my garden the first night before I noticed and the second night again when I put it on manual for just three minutes. I was having to turn on and off manual which defeats the purpose of having a timer. Luckily, my plant babies mostly remained unscathed but I was extremely unsatisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: First one, would not turn on despite new batteries. The company replaced this with a new one, now called NDS after several emails. This second one worked maybe three times and now will not turn on either. Both have a single red light flashing saying the battery is full.
customer_reviews.author: John Ghertner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, intuitive, and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: This Raindrip watering timer is the easiest and most reliable ever. Mine are over 5 yrs old and going strong even in direct sun and salt air. I originally bought another digital timer but could not get it programmed. The Raindrip one is so simple and intuitive to use. Some of the numbering has worn off from years of use so I just used a fine Sharpie maker to write them back on the face. I have recommended this to neighbors who also like it, and I have gifted it to friends. This has been a huge time saver from hand watering. No power, no problem batteries lasted me over a year running day and night.
customer_reviews.author: KLK

customer_reviews.title: Junk, lasted less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk quit within two months, due to internal water leak. I noticed it n/w two months after install because my 25 year old plum tree started dieing. Called 800 number, and they gave me an email to send all information to for replacement. Never heard anything back from Mr. Valdez and resent email 3 times. Nothing. Began to wonder if rep on phone have me a bogus email address. Bottom line: Chinese junk and no warranty support from manufacturer. Of course I was out of the return window from Amazon when I realized it wasn't working.
customer_reviews.author: Brownie

customer_reviews.title: Did not last very long
customer_reviews.text: Did not last very long. I like the fact that the timer uses standard AA batteries. It was also very easy to learn to use with the analog Diles. However, after using it just one summer, I got it out in the spring and found the battery was dead, which I expected. I replace the batteries and it worked but then the next morning would not work at all. It did not matter what batteries I put in. I clean the contacts and still no light came on it off. So I just got one year out of it. Will look for another analog timer.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Timing is everything -- and you can't set the time (but you can wait!)
customer_reviews.text: A much better timer than the POS Orbit models that are more or less equivalent. Only downside is that the start time is not independently programmable -- the start time is dependent on when you first program the unit (i.e., it's 3:20pm when you insert the batteries and set the duration, then 3:20pm is when the unit will start -- you can't set it to start at a different time). Want it to water at 5am? Get up at 5am and program it.... Other than that, it's a reliable unit that forgoes the digital screen which ultimately fails (aka Orbit).
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shut off completely
customer_reviews.text: When I received the timer I installed 2 new Energizer Max alkaline batteries and tried it out. The water flow is low when it turns on, and it doesn't seem to be able to shut the water completely off. What it turns off the water continuously trickles out. Obviously this won't work. I tried calling the company for support, but it forces me to online ordering support who "won't be able to help with product technical questions'. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Chill

customer_reviews.title: Started out great, but flooded out quick..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this timer in April, installed it on my drip system and thought it was doing great. We left on our extended vacation on May 5th, thinking all the trees and plants would be watered accordingly, until the neighbor said we had a flood going on, because the timer hadn't shut off, probably for 3 or 4 days. Raindrip has a replacement warranty with the buyer responsible for shipping and handling, so I'm not to happy about that, but will give them the chance to make this purchase a good one instead of loosing a customer completely.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep sprinkler on a timer for some dirt with newly planted grass seed. Worked fine first day. Second day I noticed the dirt was very dry. Changed the batteries (which were brand new) with another set of brand new batteries, still did not work. Tried the 'manual' watering mode, and that did not work either. Thank heavens for free return shipping at Amazon, back it goes...
customer_reviews.author: E. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Will only work in manual mode.
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions provided, although they make it look good. Found it to be very confusing. I could only get it to work in manual mode, kinda defeats the purpose. Initially set the timer, came back 2 days later to check only to find it had been continuously running off and on for that 2 days. It just about ruined my whole vegetable garden. Buy an Orbit with the time display - worth the extra 10 bucks & they last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Nutty Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set this timer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this timer. Using it in my greenhouse to turn on my misting system in the hot summer desert. So easy to change the amount of time, frequency of coming on and like the ability to manually turn it on. Nice it is battery operated so I don’t have to use an electrical cord. This is a well made timer! Will not hesitate to order this one to replace my older ones when they fail.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Water pressure issue
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. The timers operation is great. But the sole reason I want it is to have my sprinkler turn on to water my small front yard. The timer reduces the water pressure to about half. So the whole thing is useless for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: joe p

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust settings and really like the "rain delay" options!
customer_reviews.text: Still running several months later on original set of batteries for several front yard plants and a small tree). Most reliable outdoor plants watering device we have! Easy to adjust settings and really like the rain delay options. Wish I had installed one in the patio too (instead of my home-brew contraption that only I can adjust and reset!) Have it connected to an inline pressure reducer, running off an outdoor faucet via a "Y -valve so the garden hose can remain connected at the same time for other uses.
customer_reviews.author: Kodiak Biker

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality short life
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this last October 2014 and put it away without batteries during our winter which is short. Mid December thru March. Now it is not functioning and water is coming out from where it attaches to the hose bib. I am very disappointed because it was not inexpensive and now I have to order another one. But not this brand. Why can't someone make a timer that will last. I have tried another brand and it is not any better..
customer_reviews.author: Patti Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay - if you don’t mind a drop in water pressure
customer_reviews.text: This timer reduced the water pressure from my outside faucet by nearly 20 PSI. I wanted to use this for a sprinkler while out of town, but with the PSI drop, the sprinkler wasn’t able to cover the area needed. I purchased a Nelson branded timer from my local hardware store. It had no PSI drop whatsoever. I will be returning this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gabi

customer_reviews.title: These Are Great
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these timers. They are very easy to use and especially convenient if you have scattered areas to drip irrigate and can't justify the expense and labor of an in-ground, whole property system.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Knows - Usually :-)

customer_reviews.title: Good unit decent price one little caveat
customer_reviews.text: This item is based upon time frame not time of day. as long as you take that into account when you set it up it should work just fine. if you want to water everyday or every other day or every third day you have to set the automatic system during the day at that time you wanted to occur because it is only based upon time elapsed not time of day
customer_reviews.author: JAB

customer_reviews.title: Water without worry!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Just used it while on a two week vacay and all my plants were alive when we came back...yea!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Broken out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. This device arrived broken out of the box. While it looks ok it has never worked. I have not contacted the company yet since I have very little free time. Of course, that's why I bought it, so I do not have to water by hand every day. Thank G-d for the abundant rain we have received this year.
customer_reviews.author: REJ

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Only automatic watering system i have found that consistently works...my last one went almost three years before it finally died from the brutal SC sun. All others i have tried usually fail in the first winter or sooner (had an Orbit model fail within days). This does not have all the bells and whistles, but I have not gone out and seen water spraying all over the house due to a failure like so many others I have tried. Very dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Arch

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this when I planted grass seed in a bare spot of my yard. Everything worked well except for the rain delay. The rain delay didn't work at all for me. I caught the sprinkler spraying while it was raining outside. That's not a big deal for me though and my grass is growing great now thanks to this timer.
customer_reviews.author: Mermalion

customer_reviews.title: No what was shown
customer_reviews.text: I am very upset and displeased by this purchase since in the pictures for this product, it shows a kit. I did not receive a kit I only received the raindrip, if that was the case I wouldn’t have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael Medina

customer_reviews.title: Workgreat
customer_reviews.text: I hate timers! However these Raindrip R675CT are really good, work well and are the only timers I will use. Depending on your daily schedule the batteries last a long time and l have five (5) hooked up and working all summer long. I do remove the timers and batteries in the Fall and reuse them the next spring/summer.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Don't by refurbished one!
customer_reviews.text: Don't order this "refurbished" unit, unless you want to end up returning. The battery case was broken, so no way was this ever tested. I'm surprised, because i have bought plenty of refurbished items in the past, without issue. Not sure how well it works. Returned unable to try it.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper's anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Won't seal
customer_reviews.text: Got this in May, and just now tried to hook it up. Water spews out around the input. Tried a better washer, but nothing stopped it, water even comes out under the seal. Too bad, this would have been perfect for my back flower garden if it had worked. I am returning it and getting another brand.
customer_reviews.author: GaryC

customer_reviews.title: Items not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this kit specifically because it pictured the ground cover kit included with the timer; however, when it arrived I only received the timer. Where's the rest of the kit. I'm not a fan of bait and switch tactics, or false advertising. This is going right back for a refund. A word to the seller, change the photos to reflect the product.
customer_reviews.author: G. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: So far, seems to work very well...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to water my garden while away on vacation. Typically, I don’t trust sprinkler timers for long term use as I’ve had other brands that have stayed on all day wasting untold gallons of water. Keep fresh batteries in these devices and use with caution as you could end up with a huge water bill. However, I’ve been testing this for a couple weeks now and it’s worked without issue. Only complaint is the manual and rain delay knobs do not revert back to the reset position.
customer_reviews.author: Triforce86

customer_reviews.title: Reliabilitu
customer_reviews.text: This my second unit and had the exactly same problem. It runs normal until around one year of use. The problem is, it turns on as set but it won't shut off as set after one year of use. Replace new battery didn't solve the problem. Purchase at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Chih Ming Hsieh

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 1 season
customer_reviews.text: Updated - product lasted only 1 year and failed. Label surface was pealing off. Manual dial stopped working - would not turn unit on. Changing batteries made no difference. Hose fittings started to leak. I have had other timer products last much longer. Works as advertised but would be a better product if the user could set time rather than time being determined relative to whenever the unit is configured. Directions and online description need to make this clearer. Yes setup is easy, and the directions cover that. But addition of a clear statement that the user cannot set time, time is determined relative to startup would have avoided disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find a water controller that could do more granular timings. Most of the ones in the stores won't go under six hours and had too much watering time. In this case, it's controlling direct watering into my sub-irrigation buckets for my garden. Combined with some dripped ends on some of them, this lets me keep water to my tomatoes during the day.
customer_reviews.author: CQCoder

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to use, works well so far
customer_reviews.text: The timer is easy to use. The analog style control is actually easier to understand than the digital one We bought earlier (Orbit 62061Z 1-Outlet Programmable Timer). We didn't find the instruction but can guess how it works. The online video confirms it. It works out fairly well for our drip system, which we would like to get it running several times a day. For its outdoor use, it got hot easily if exposed under the sun for a period of time. It may be a good idea to add some protection to extend its lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: So far ok using for a few days. Comes with quick instruction but not enough. How rain delay works? No immediate "on" setting or "no timer" setting. so have to wait one hour (min. setting )to see sprinkle pattern or strength of water that made sprinkle over me while adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Tech description is found on company’s website.
customer_reviews.text: Included operating instructions are sketchy. Tech description on company website states it needs to be installed vertically to work. Also, when you set the controls to run for 10 minutes every hour, for example, water does not begin to flow until an hour passes. In effect, setting the controls resets the timer’s internal clock. Once I got past these two issues I found the product works well for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: PBJ

customer_reviews.title: Great automated watering system
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have all of the complex features of other automated watering systems, but it does its job well. I haven't bothered with watering my garden in over a month since this has been handling it, and my garden is exploding. The battery lasts longer than I expected, too. Very good investment if you want to make sure your garden stays watered.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Malin

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked it bought as a back up Broaden right out of the box JUNK please make sure things work when you by them Chinese junk usually is broken anyway check it fast so you can get your money back I waited to long
customer_reviews.author: Brock Fergusson

customer_reviews.title: Nice product - Designed well - Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 4 years later-Mine has performed flawlessly with an astonishingly long battery life, I use this everyday of the year for 4 years now. Bought solely because it has a frequency below 6 hours which seems to be the standard minimum for garden hose timers. It actually goes to 1 hour. Very simple to use, a 3 year old could use it, literally. Other great features for me: -Battery compartment requires no tools -Manual watering duration can be set -Dials are smooth yet lock solidly into each selection -Could not be simpler to program/operate -Chassis is sturdy -Takes less than 5 seconds to change any freq/duration to any other freq/duration.
customer_reviews.author: pizelli

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: good little timer for water flow, gonna order 3 more as we use them not only on drip system for plants but for watering systems on chickens and pigs. easiest ever for chickens just let the 6 ft hose run into a rubber feed pan done. hose is up high and water drops thru the air into the pan at a rate that keeps pan at least 1/2 full.
customer_reviews.author: susan l guith

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working. Bought 4 months ago and set it up less than 30 days ago.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this timer to water my vegetables in the back of the house and it was perfect until it stopped working. Upon inspecting it I noticed it was probably opened before and perhaps fixed before it was sold to me. I have another one of these same timers and it's still working in the greenhouse even with hard water. I didn't purchase the one that still works from the same company. The timer in itself is very good. It has rain delay, manual operation that doesn't interfere with schedule, and several options for time and frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Rios

customer_reviews.title: They only last one season
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have said, these units work great but only last about a season. I’ve had two that experienced valve failures where the valve does not close after being opened and floods my plants and wastes water. Both of these units failed in the season after purchasing them. I wish there were an alternative that had better build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O

customer_reviews.title: It lasted two years, wishing for more longevity.
customer_reviews.text: It died just before two growing seasons were over. I had to jury rig the throat of the faucet attachment with a rubber band gasget and a plastic bag to protect the rubber band gasget from the sun. Hopefully the replacement will last a bit longer. . . .
customer_reviews.author: An observent customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap will break really easy.
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of your money. As soon as I attached it to the hose it broke apart. I just moved the hose a little and the part that attaches to the the hose broke off the timer. Do not buy and waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Georgios

customer_reviews.title: Works good, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I found this very easy to set up and it is running fine for me. I reset or delay when I know I will mow my lawn and then kick it off again. I only need hours in between watering, not at specific times. Has been great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia McNally

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and in love with it vs. the Orbit model also sold by AMZN. Thankfully it took the spot of the Orbit that failed after 2 years. This unit is much easier to use, takes AA vs AAA batteries, so hopefully will last longer and was $6 cheaper. Hope it lasts?
customer_reviews.author: Stingy buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a few weeks and my plants are doing great now that I don't forget to water them. Easy to set. If you know its gonna rain, you can choose rain delay and it keeps your scheduled settings afterwards. Pick up a cheap pressure regulator and backflow preventer for a few bucks at big box store. Highly recommend doing that before using.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Pool Stayed Full
customer_reviews.text: I installed the timer to fill my pool while I was away on vacation. Living in Texas, summers are like living on the sun!! Evaporation in the pool is a huge problem. I monitored the unit before I left on vacation and it performed perfectly. It work perfectly while I was away. Buy this unit!!
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Like all water timers
customer_reviews.text: I have bought numerous water timers over the past ten years, They all failed after, at most, two seasons. Those with LED systems are hard to set and nearly impossible to read in sunlight. the ones with little dials are fiddly and the version I had deteriorated in the sun. The pair of these seem to be doing well in the second year of use. Like all water timers, remove them in the fall and take out the batteries. Be sure to get the water out of the unit, as it tends to stay inside unless tilted etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have been using orbit timers until now, thought I'd try this, one, works as advertised, but I don't like that you can not set the time of day for operations. other than that am using it daily
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste your Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and used in for less than 3 months during the summer. I removed the unit and battery from the water system and stored in the garden shed all winter. I went and tried to re-connect it in July and when I tried attaching it to the water faucet it just broke off. It is held by a very thin piece of metal where it attached to the ware faucet. I tried to contact the manufacturer and left emails but received no reply what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: rabellmor

customer_reviews.title: Does not follow programmed cycle
customer_reviews.text: Unit did not work after the first cycle. Even after resetting, the unit would run on it's own schedule rather than how it was programmed. I missed the return window or I would have returned.
customer_reviews.author: A2Bill

customer_reviews.title: makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as I am growing a garden with herbs and flowers but sometimes I would forget to water them. So I am using this item to help me water my garden without me thinking if I had watered it or not. Haven't tried it for long so we'll see how long this quality lasts but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Simple, functional, great value
customer_reviews.text: Used this all summer, worked great! You can program delays, it senses when it's rained so you don't waste your water, and one battery lasted all summer easily. My only gripe is that you have to program it at the time you want it to run... so if you wanted it to run every two days at 3am, you would have to go outside and program it at 3am. This thing doesn't know what time it is. But for this price, I can live with that. Also, this is just impression, but this thing feels burly, not 3oz of plastic
customer_reviews.author: Smed

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works very well for my flower pots watering system. Had to get a new one because previous timer sprung a leak. Would have been 5 star if it had lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: D.J. Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: I love the drip system I bought but this control box ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the drip system I bought but this control box only lasted a year before it's started leaking. I purchased another one which wasn't expensive so I'm up and running again but I would expect something like this to last longer than a year. Especially since I disconnected it and stored it in my garage over the winter only to hook it up and have it leak.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good little timer.
customer_reviews.text: Have several different timers. Those with the most options require so many steps to program them I can never remember from one year to the next. In theory they may be great but I don't need all the options and I end up not using them. This inexpensive timer does a good job of combining ease of programming with sufficient watering options to make it user friendly. Some reviewers have had problems with breakage but I set it up where it isn't stressed and won't be banged into. It held up throughout the season.with no apparent signs of aging.
customer_reviews.author: A. Quint

customer_reviews.title: it's a mystery timer
customer_reviews.text: easy to install , light blinks , works on manual setting,have no idea if the timer is, so far no automatic watering has taken place starting to wonder tried to call 24/7 support left messages left message on line no reply , starting no clock so no way of knowing if its going to work when I leave. starting to think retail store might have been a better choice, no reset instructions, amazons choice really, second bad choice in 2 wks
customer_reviews.author: mike mcall

customer_reviews.title: Came dead out of box!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it came dead out the box. Does not have a setting to tell time. Just starts from the time you set it up. I tried three different sets of batteries to make sure I wasn't dealing with bad batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delays are annoying and prevent immediate watering cycle.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue is that when you set the timer, it waits for that amount of time to turn on. If you set it for 3 minutes every hour, it will turn on in one hour for 3 minutes. I would like it to turn on immediately, then again in one hour. Because of this, I couldn't test my oscillating sprinkler pattern and ended up watering the side of my house. There is also a delay in the manual timer. It has a 2-3 second delay when you turn it on and again when you turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: lairbear

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Own 4 of these units for the past 5 years with only one failing. Easy to use after you read the instructions and fairly durable with Michigan weather.
customer_reviews.author: BBS

customer_reviews.title: I like this water timer
customer_reviews.text: This Raindrip water timer works very well. No complaints at all. I now have two of these timers for the yards. To be on the safe side, I do remove them from the outdoor faucets when freezing condition are expected. I think most all of the internal parts are plastic and may not hold up well if the water inside the timer freezes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have regular alkaline batts and have been going for 8 months, keeping an eye on the blinking light that lets you know batteries are weak, still at 1 blink(three straight blinks,change), love this raindrop, use it to water bamboo and keep a small Koi pond topped off using a water well. I set it for every 2 hrs, 30min each time. The water well pump is a energy hog and also was turning on and off too often, had to change out a pressure switch after running the new pump only after 4 months, Now its been going 8 months, and its perfect thanks to the raindrip.
customer_reviews.author: mauricio perez-cross

customer_reviews.title: Failed on second day in on mode running my well dry!  DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This item failed in the on mode on it's second day. This ran for hours running my well dry. There are other brands of timers available that aren't great but not as bad as this. I strongly recommend looking at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set and easy to read. Access is easy. Only question is battery lif. It has been operating on same batteries for 5 weeks so far
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One month later and it's no longer working
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. But stopped opening valve after a month of use. Changed batteries and reset the unit to no avail. Opened it up to see if it was anything fixable but nothing seemed damaged. Back to Orbit I go, at least their products lasted over a year.
customer_reviews.author: NM85

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason this didn’t work, wouldn’t turn the water on when programmed. Had to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica H

customer_reviews.title: Watering control
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice uunit, easy to set-up, works very well and allows for easy control of watering schedule
customer_reviews.author: Larry's Kindle

customer_reviews.title: The easiest, most economical and durable Water timer
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest, most economical and durable Water timer I have purchased. Very well made, came quickly, packed well and setup in under 5 min's and I have 2 hose's running off it. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Walden

customer_reviews.title: Love it, very simpe
customer_reviews.text: Under the Solutions to a Problem, it says Increase Frequency or Reduce Run Time, but should say Reduce Frequency or Reduce Run Time.
customer_reviews.author: Dean D Oquist

customer_reviews.title: Simple but good
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for one hose, two time periods per day. Can't adjust more than that but it works great if you just need Basic timer.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon H

customer_reviews.title: I bought my first Raindrip timer earlier this spring (2015) ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first Raindrip timer earlier this spring (2015) and it worked well. Simple to operate. I bought the second on in June of 2015. I was working well until it quit. I thought I might need to replace the batteries, so I pulled the battery carriage out and discover water inside the mechanism. I tried to dry it out with a hair dryer on low .... no luck. The first one I bought is still working well. Maybe I just got a faulty timer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Corum

customer_reviews.title: Best timer yet
customer_reviews.text: This timer replaced 1 year orbit from Lowe's. I was hesitant at first but read reviews. Easy set up best part quiet. Does shake water pipes turn off. The orbit shook so. So far this has been great. I did purchase extended warranty. Enjoy days not having get up early water lawn.
customer_reviews.author: B. B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, our grass died
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. We got this to automatically time our front lawn sprinkler and it doesn’t work. We’ve swapped batteries, reset it. Doesn’t work. Should have just spent the extra $10 to buy the digital one we have for our backyard...
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: You will have to set up at the time you want to water, I.e. 4AM?, then you will need to set it up at 4AM
customer_reviews.author: Digesterman

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong - Running for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I run this 9 months a year. So far so good. No issues. I typically run my drip irrigation off this, but also run hoses for sprinkler a couple times a year.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wiest

customer_reviews.title: NIce unit
customer_reviews.text: Needs a little more adjustment in the time sequences; but it works, waters twice a day just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Laz

customer_reviews.title: Still running on the second year!
customer_reviews.text: I had one for a year and this is my second one. I haven’t changed the battery for the second year. I take them off before freezing temperature. I wrap it with ceramic wrap to protect it from getting wet. I think I took good care of it and it took good care of my plants! ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Make sure u seat battery tray.
customer_reviews.text: Little light wouldn't blink until I really gave battery tray a good deal of pressure to seat it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This timer works really well, and I'm satisfied to the point that I'm ordering two more.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Good solid craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, has a solid sturdy casing, attachments are of high quality (metal not plastic), easy and simple to use, highly recommend. Functions are straight-forward, so unlike digital equivalents, you would not have as many options in programming (such as setting to a specific time).
customer_reviews.author: M. Yi

customer_reviews.title: Current Time Can Not Be Set
customer_reviews.text: Unit needs to be manually reset for current time. If you want it to go off at 5AM, you need to physically be there at 5AM ro initially set it. The Orbit sprinkler for the same price works better.
customer_reviews.author: Jack P.

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Being able to turn the sprinkler on and not having to worry about turning it off or how long it's been on is awesome! Set it and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even turn on
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Put batteries in and it wouldn't even turn on. You still same batteries on another water timer and worked fine. I probably got a dead, but I wasn't able to return because the window had already closed.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: No clock; you must be present first time
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't they make this thing with a clock? To get this system started, you must be physically present to start the program the first time. Too bad if for some reason you want to water at 3 am. So much simpler with a clock!
customer_reviews.author: A. L.

customer_reviews.title: Gone Bad after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Update: I bought this July 2015 and it has now stopped working. Still lights up but will not work. We have replaced the batteries etc, and still won't work- manual nor automatic. At least the failure doesn't result in it not shutting off- no flooding. This saved my marriage. I no longer have the problem of forgetting to turn the water off. The many options feature make watering super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheshechic

customer_reviews.title: Drip water Timer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, setup and use. Works great and has good features.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Just as described, I would buy this again for other areas of my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice timer. Works as expected. Super easy to install and figure out.
customer_reviews.author: david m. herring

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace their discontinued round model. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace their discontinued round model. This is basically all the same controls, battery-powered (2 AAA) to turn on or off water a specific number of times per day for a specific duration. For the applications I'm using it for (an automated sprouter and a terrarium for starter plants) it works PERFECTLY. I am using this in a laundry room indoors, and it does not leak at all.
customer_reviews.author: C. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Leaks like a sieve
customer_reviews.text: Water leaks and sprays between the parts of the connector. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Sooz

customer_reviews.title: Worked Well!
customer_reviews.text: I had seen complaints about the durability of this timer in a number of reviews; it will take until next season to see if the 2 we purchased still work. That said, they worked to perfection this past season. At its price, I will buy them again if and when they reach end of life.
customer_reviews.author: E. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was amazing...but it's horrible
customer_reviews.text: So I had high hopes for this. It gets pretty good reviews. I hooked it up and all was good. My garden got watered everyday and I didn't even have to lift a finger. Fast forward 2 months from when I started using it and the thing is dead. Will not turn the water on. Tried several sets of batteries and nothing. DEAD. Very disappointed. Why can't anything just work!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The timer didn't last too long.
customer_reviews.text: Although the timer was pretty easy to use, it didn't have staying power. Even with new batteries, the auto mode only lasted 1&1/2 years. Conked out while I was on vacation, and I came home to a pretty distressed vegetable garden.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
